tagline: The iTunes Search API allows you to place search fields in your website to search for content within the iTunes Store, App Store, iBooks Store and Mac App Store.
description: The iTunes Search API allows you to place search fields in your website to search for content within the iTunes Store, App Store, iBooks Store and Mac App Store.

blocks.name: search
blocks.description: Search for content within the iTunes Store, App Store, iBooks Store and Mac App Store.

args.name: term
args.info: The text string you want to search for.

args.name: country
args.info: The two-letter country code for the store you want to search.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of search results you want the iTunes Store to return. In range 1 - 200.The default is 50.

args.name: lang
args.info: The language, English or Japanese, you want to use when returning search results. Specify the language using the five-letter codename. The default is en_us (English).

args.name: term
args.info: The text string you want to search for.

args.name: country
args.info: The two-letter country code for the store you want to search.

args.name: entity
args.info: The type of results you want returned, one of movieArtist, movie.

args.name: attribute
args.info: The attribute you want to search for in the stores, one of actorTerm, genreIndex, artistTerm, shortFilmTerm, producerTerm, ratingTerm, directorTerm, releaseYearTerm, featureFilmTerm, movieArtistTerm, movieTerm, ratingIndex, descriptionTerm.

blocks.name: getContentById
blocks.description: Look up content by iTunes ID.

args.name: contentId
args.info: Id of content for Retrieving.

args.name: term
args.info: The text string you want to search for.

args.name: country
args.info: The two-letter country code for the store you want to search.

args.name: media
args.info: The media type you want to search for. The default is all.

args.name: entity
args.info: The type of results you want returned, relative to the specified media type. For example: movieArtist for a movie media type search. The default is the track entity associated with the specified media type.

args.name: attribute
args.info: The attribute you want to search for in the stores, relative to the specified media type. For example, if you want to search for an artist by name specify entity=allArtist&attribute=allArtistTerm. In this example, if you search for term=maroon, iTunes returns “Maroon 5” in the search results, instead of all artists who have ever recorded a song with the word "maroon" in the title.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of search results you want the iTunes Store to return. In range 1 - 200.The default is 50.

args.name: lang
args.info: The language, English or Japanese, you want to use when returning search results. Specify the language using the five-letter codename. The default is en_us (English).

blocks.name: getContentByUpc
blocks.description: Look up an album or video by its UPC.

args.name: upc
args.info: UPC of album or video.

args.name: term
args.info: The text string you want to search for.

args.name: country
args.info: The two-letter country code for the store you want to search.

args.name: media
args.info: The media type you want to search for. The default is all.

args.name: entity
args.info: The type of results you want returned, relative to the specified media type. For example: movieArtist for a movie media type search. The default is the track entity associated with the specified media type.

args.name: attribute
args.info: The attribute you want to search for in the stores, relative to the specified media type. For example, if you want to search for an artist by name specify entity=allArtist&attribute=allArtistTerm. In this example, if you search for term=maroon, iTunes returns “Maroon 5” in the search results, instead of all artists who have ever recorded a song with the word "maroon" in the title.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of search results you want the iTunes Store to return. In range 1 - 200.The default is 50.

args.name: lang
args.info: The language, English or Japanese, you want to use when returning search results. Specify the language using the five-letter codename. The default is en_us (English).

args.info: International standard book number.

args.name: term
args.info: The text string you want to search for.

args.name: country
args.info: The two-letter country code for the store you want to search.

args.name: media
args.info: The media type you want to search for. The default is all.

args.name: entity
args.info: The type of results you want returned, relative to the specified media type. For example: movieArtist for a movie media type search. The default is the track entity associated with the specified media type.

args.name: attribute
args.info: The attribute you want to search for in the stores, relative to the specified media type. For example, if you want to search for an artist by name specify entity=allArtist&attribute=allArtistTerm. In this example, if you search for term=maroon, iTunes returns “Maroon 5” in the search results, instead of all artists who have ever recorded a song with the word "maroon" in the title.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of search results you want the iTunes Store to return. In range 1 - 200.The default is 50.

args.name: lang
args.info: The language, English or Japanese, you want to use when returning search results. Specify the language using the five-letter codename. The default is en_us (English).

args.info: The text string you want to search for.

args.name: country
args.info: The two-letter country code for the store you want to search.

args.name: media
args.info: The media type you want to search for. The default is all.

args.name: entity
args.info: The type of results you want returned, relative to the specified media type. For example: movieArtist for a movie media type search. The default is the track entity associated with the specified media type.

args.name: attribute
args.info: The attribute you want to search for in the stores, relative to the specified media type. For example, if you want to search for an artist by name specify entity=allArtist&attribute=allArtistTerm. In this example, if you search for term=maroon, iTunes returns “Maroon 5” in the search results, instead of all artists who have ever recorded a song with the word "maroon" in the title.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of search results you want the iTunes Store to return. In range 1 - 200.The default is 50.

args.name: lang
args.info: The language, English or Japanese, you want to use when returning search results. Specify the language using the five-letter codename. The default is en_us (English).
